content.question: A perfectly competitive firm finds that for the last shirt that it produces and sells, the marginal revenue is <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>20</mn></math> and the marginal cost is <math alttext="$22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>22</mn></math>. The firm should

choices.label: charge <math alttext="$22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>22</mn></math> to maximize profit
produce more shirts to increase profit
produce fewer shirts to increase profit
hire more workers to increase production
shut down if the average variable cost is less than <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>20</mn></math>

content.answer: produce fewer shirts to increase profit
